intro: Gynotroches micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered gynotroche, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features compound leaves with a finely divided structure, and its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The plant is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
